title: References
subject: C++ Programming
theory:
New in C++. 
Alias for an existing variable. 
Cannot be NULL. Cannot be reseated. 
Syntax `int &ref = var;`.

common_mistakes.correction: Reference MUST be initialized when declared. `int &r;` is Error.

interview_questions.question: Pointer vs Reference?
interview_questions.answer: Pointer: Can be NULL, Re-assignable, needs dereferencing. Reference: Cannot be NULL, Fixed target, auto dereferenced.
